message_1:
Suppose we have a message "ATTACK". Encrypt this message using the Hill cipher with the encryption matrix 

$$\begin{pmatrix} 3 & 1 \\ 4 & 2 \end{pmatrix}$$

What is the resulting ciphertext?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "ATTACK" using the Hill cipher with the given encryption matrix, we first need to convert the letters to their corresponding numerical values (A=0, B=1, ..., Z=25). Then, we group the letters in pairs and multiply each pair by the encryption matrix. Finally, we convert the resulting numerical values back to letters.

Message: ATTACK
Numerical values: 0 19 19 0 2 10

Grouped in pairs:
(0, 19)
(19, 0)
(2, 10)

Now, we multiply each pair by the encryption matrix:

$$\begin{pmatrix} 3 & 1 \\ 4 & 2 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 19 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 19 \\ 38 \end{pmatrix}$$

$$\begin{pmatrix} 3 & 1 \\ 4 & 2 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 19 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 57 \\ 76 \end{pmatrix}$$

$$\begin{pmatrix} 3 & 1 \\ 4 & 2 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 10 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 32 \\ 44 \end{pmatrix}$$

Now, we need to take the results modulo 26 to get the encrypted numerical values:

(19, 12)
(5, 24)
(6, 18)

Finally, we convert these numerical values back to letters:

T M F Y G S

So, the resulting ciphertext is "TMFYGS".
